metatags.og:title: The co-founder of Loom sold his biz for ~$1B, made $50-70M personally, then walked away from an extra $60M | Sam Parr posted on the topic | LinkedIn
metatags.og:description:
The co-founder of Loom sold his biz for ~$1B, made $50-70M personally, then walked away from an extra $60M

He has “no income right now” and is “looking for internships”...

Vinay Hiremath has a wild post-exit story. we talked about it on Moneywise:

-Turned down $60M in retention bonuses that would've vested over 4 years
-Said "the trees spoke to me" during a redwoods hike when deciding whether to stay. He wasn’t joking.
-He had a post go viral about his identity crisis after selling (1.5m views)

So I asked about his money situation now:

-Monthly spend: $25K (with $12K on NYC rent)
-Net worth allocation: 50% cash, 30% equities, 20% bonds/other
-Most expensive post-exit purchase: iPad

Now he’s studying physics 5-8 hours daily, hanging in Discord groups with 18-year-olds who think he's their peer… looking to intern as a mechanical engineer

(can you imagine the founder of a billion-dollar company being your intern?)

On the pod he explains why he’s betting his future on physical products ins

metatags.og:description: curr: physics & mechanical engineering, prev: co-founder @loom

socialmediaposting.articlebody: worst thing you can run into in solidworks. cad equivalent of a segfault.
imagining @AndrewYang dressed in a christmas onesie crying happy tears when a new model drops because it's 1 day closer to universal basic income
Have been living out of a tent in the factory. Learning is back on an exponential curve. White noise of the machines has been leading to green whoop sleep scores 🤖🟢
We now have a production infrastructure with an extremely unique networking topology and a wild roadmap. Customer deployments are coming through fast. If you are/know a mid/senior level backend...
Get this asked once a month. Yes @adarsh_exe and I are related. We are cousins building the Hiremath dynasty together.
America has already dominated Britain in every conceivable way. Let’s carry on the tradition and settle this in the ring
Oh yeah and they lost to India. Over essentially a giant protest. I think I got this in the bag genetically 🤣 But maybe I should ask @KianSadeghi5 and @nucleusgenomics first
Willing to box anyone who is decently high profile in tech. Down for any height if weight within bounds: 145lb (can cut down to 125) ~1.5 years training (with 6mo break)
I recently joined a hardware startup as a mechanical engineering intern, broadly working on "physical AI." Happy to share more privately, but we are looking for software engineers and a mechE lead.

These are the roles we're looking for: - Backend engineer (software, high throughput data pipes) - Fullstack engineer (software, backend strong) - RF engineer (SDR, networking, etc.) - AI/perceptio...
If this seems interesting to you or you know anyone, my DMs are open. Onsite in SF only. Low meeting/bullshit/process culture. Group of extremely high agency people.
Vinay wired $1.7M to his parents just before selling Loom. said it’s the coolest thing money has ever bought him.
The co-founder of Loom sold his biz for ~$1B, made $50-70M personally, then walked away from an extra $60M He has “no income right now” and is “looking for internships”... @vhmth has...
If anyone can pull this off, it’s @SamCorcos. God speed friend. Thank you

metatags.twitter:title: The Power Loom and The Founders Pillars | 2025 Tribeca Festival | Tribeca
metatags.og:title: The Power Loom and The Founders Pillars | 2025 Tribeca Festival | Tribeca
metatags.og:description: The Founders Pillars is a two-part installation: The Power Loom, a multimedia installation that digitally weaves African textiles, and a site-specific Augmented Reality (AR) experience that uses those very patterns and visualizations to transform the columns of the New York Stock Exchange into a memorial to enslaved peoples. By Lesiba Mabitsela, Meghna Singh, and Simon Wood.
